decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 20 October 2022, being the date of granting of planning permission P/2021/1758.

Reason: To accord with the provisions of Section 92 (1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (337-P02-00, 337-P02- 01, 337-P02-02, 337-P02-03, 337-P02-04, Design and Access Statement, London Development Database Management, Landmark Contaminated Land Report, Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment and Statement of Community Involvement. Received on 12 May 2021; Archaeology Desk-Based Assessment & Heritage Statement. Received on 1 June 2021; Transport Note Addendum. Received on 20 October 2021; Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Daylight and Sunlight Report, Design and Access Statement Addendum, Energy and Sustainability Statement, Outline Fire Safety Statement, Planning Statement, Written Scheme of Investigation for Archaeological Evaluation, SUDs Assessment Report and Transport Statement. Received on 24 August 2022; Context CGI Scene 1 and Context CGI Scene 2. Received on 4 October 2022; 2312-PL-03, 2312-PL-04 and Design Development Supporting Statement. Received on 13/06/2023; 2312-PL-21, 2312-PL23 and 2312-PL25. Received on 07/08/2023; 2312-PL-01-A, 2312-S-01-C and 2312-PL-02-B. 20/09/2023; Written Scheme of Investigation (WSI) for an Archaeological Watching Brief [dated December 2023]. Received on 05/02/2024; Archaeological Watching Brief [dated March 2024]. Received on 13/03/2024) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are used.

Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the materials approved under P/2023/3171.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.
Condition : 4 - Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development, all landscaping comprised in the approved details shall be carried and the boundary treatment as shown in the Design and Access Statement Addendum received on 24 August 2022 and drawings numbered 2312-PL-02-B and 2312-S-01-C shall be erected in strict accordance with the approved plans.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and area.
Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Reason: To protect neighbours' living conditions and the character and appearance of the area and to prevent over-intensive use of the site.
Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.
Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, the development shall have been constructed to achieve an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.

Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.
Condition : 8 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following: 

-	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification. 

-	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme. 

-	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Reason: In the interests of sustainable development. 
Condition : 9 - All windows serving bathrooms of the hereby approved development as shown on drawing numbers 2312-PL-01-A and 2312-PL-02-B shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Reason: To safeguard the visual amenities of the locality and privacy of future occupiers.
Condition : 10 - The development shall take place in accordance with the details contained within the approved Constructions Logistics Plan under P/2023/1990.

Reason: In order to ensure highway safety is maintained and preserved and to safeguard the amenities of adjoining residential properties
Condition : 11 - Hours of demolition and construction

No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents.
Condition : 12 - a) The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which this permission refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the plant operate. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or one metre from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142. An alternative position for assessment/measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria are achieved.

b) The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter. 

c) Following installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014 (Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. The post completion report shall be both completed and submitted to the local authority within 28 days of completion of the installation for review. If the plant fails to meet the specified standard, remedial measures shall be put in place immediately and the noise assessment shall be carried out again.  This shall be repeated until the assessment has reached the required standard. Once achieved, the plant shall be maintained permanently thereaft
Condition : 13 - Reinstate footway

Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, the existing vehicular access along St Mary's Drive shall be permanently closed and the kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the and in the interests of highway safety.
Condition : 14 - Highway safety

The highway safety measures (consisting of double yellow lines along the access road) approved under P/2023/1716 shall be implemented before any dwelling within the development is first occupied and retained as such, without obstruction, for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In order to enhance the pedestrian environment and to confine vehicular access to the permitted points in order to ensure that the development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or highway safety along the adjacent highway.
Condition : 15 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 16 bicycles) for the occupants of the development shall be made available for use in accordance with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 16 - Refuse and recycling storage

Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development the waste and recycling stores shown on the Design and Access Statement Addendum received on 24 August 2022 and drawings numbered 2312-PL-02-B and 2312-S-01-C shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the lifetime of the development. Bins shall be stored within the stores at all times and shall not be left on the public highway.

Reason: In order to ensure adequate provision for waste and recycling.
Condition : 17 - The development shall take place in accordance with the details contained within the approved Archaeological Watching Brief [dated March 2024].

The development shall not be occupied until the post excavation assessment has been completed in accordance with the programme set out in the approved Written Scheme of Investigation and the provision for analysis, publication and dissemination of the results and archive deposition has been secured. 

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the area.
Condition : 18 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/1479, approved on 18/07/2023. 

During the course of the development:

A.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 
Before the development is first brought into use:

B.	Any necessary scheme for decontamination required by clause A) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.

Supporting Notes:
(i)	The full Phase II site investigation, where required, must include sampling and/or testing for soil and groundwater contamination, soil gasses, vapours and leachate and test for potential contaminants identified within the Phase I Preliminary Risk Assessment. 
(ii)	The investigation shall be carried out at such points and at such depths as the local planning authority may stipulate. 
(iii)	Testing for Total Hydrocarbons shall be undertaken using the TPH-CWG method. Where significant contamination is identified, to fully characterise the site the extent of this contamination should be confirmed by further intrusive site investigation and testing (i.e. delineation works). 
(iv)	Risk assessments must adhere to current UK guidance and best practice. 
(v)	The Council requests that site investigation reports or site plans be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk or by
Condition : 19 - The drainage system and associated drainage features approved under P/2023/1716 shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Reason: In order to prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site.
Condition : 20 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Reason: In order to ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed.
Condition : 21 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the recommendations approved in the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal received on 12 May 2021.

Reason: In the interests of nature conservation.
Condition : 22 - Tree retention

The hereby approved development shall be implemented in accordance with the recommendations approved in the Arboricultural Impact Assessment, during construction to protect the health of existing trees, by methods that conform to the best practice guidance contained in British Standard BS5837:2012 or any guidance that shall have superseded it.

All new trees shall be planted in accordance with the details and times stated in the approved specification and in accordance with British Standard 8545:2014 (or an equivalent British Standard if replaced).

Any trees or shrubs planted (including any such replacements) which die within five years from the date of planting shall be replaced in the next planting season with the same species, and of comparable maturity. The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approval.

Reason: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and the area and to promote biodiversity.
Condition : 23 - Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO).

No dwelling shall be occupied until accreditation has been achieved and evidence of such accreditation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In pursuance of the Council's duty under section 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998.
description: Variation to wording of Condition 6 to remove the need for zero/low carbon monitoring following permission 00897/OPP5/P2 (P/2023/1810) dated 16/04/2024 for Variation of Condition 2 (approved plans) for revised drawings for planning permission 00897/OPP5/P1 for the demolition of existing garages and erection of part two, part three storey building, comprising three flats and five houses including associated cycle storage, landscaping, refuse and recycling storage.
